tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Grand Designs Revisited
programme.desc: Kevin returns to see Sue and Martin in Devon. In 1999, they began the renovation of a couple of 16th and 18th century barns. Two decades later, Kevin finds a home lovingly, painstakingly transformed. (Final)

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Millie Ross meets an artist who creates cultural works with plants, Costa Georgiadis visits Clarence Slockee in his garden, Jerry Coleby-Williams shows different ways to propagate, and Josh Byrne plants out a wetzone.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: Chance encounters for cousins Jolyon and Soames Forsyte, rival heirs to the family firm, throw their previously steady lives into disarray.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks into literature and language with the learned and lettered Lloyd Langford, Victoria Coren Mitchell, Jack Whitehall and Alan Davies.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: Amateur musicians take to pianos in train stations while being secretly watched by performers, Lang Lang and Mika. Who will they choose to play at the Royal Festival Hall? Their search begins in Kings Cross St Pancras.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Annabel Crabbs Civic Duty
programme.desc: We begin with one of the enduring oddities of the Australian electoral system - preferential voting. Vaunted by mathematicians and theorists as a fairer way of voting. Adopted, uniquely, by Australia in 1918.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Rosa and Craig convert a decommissioned steam railway reservoir into a home. Faced with a pandemic, numerous money crises, pregnancy and a schedule that balloons from 1 year to over 3 years - will it all be worth it?

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns with the specialists for a second visit to the Devon coast home of the cadets of the Britannia Royal Naval College, Dartmouth.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: New Yorks new millennial mayor offers a masterclass in political campaigning in the twilight of traditional media. A tech journalist pinged for gaming gadget reviews that are undisclosed ads. Plus Disney+ gambling loophole.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry takes a light-hearted look at levity, levitation and lights with Josh Widdicombe, Sue Perkins, Frank Skinner and Alan Davies.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Crime Night!
programme.sub-title: You Lost Me At, "I Like You"
programme.desc: Host Julia Zemiro and expert criminologists Professor Danielle Reynald and Dr David Bartlett are joined by Rhys Nicholson and Steph Tisdell to dive into the pervasive issue of phishing scams.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Find out how amazing your hands are in todays lab when the doctors go head to head in a thumb challenge, and discover how drones are helping emergency rescue crews reach patients fast in Investigation Ouch.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer thinks the Farmer is planning to replace him, so Shaun helps to knock his friend into shape.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand tries to sleep standing up, then finds out how virtual reality can help in surgery, before he and Dr Chris count down five things that make your skin crawl!

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve witnesses a serval hunting in the weird surroundings of a power station at night, puts snakes to the test in a chomp-off and meets a rare spider.

programme.title: Mythbusters: Theres Your Problem!
programme.desc: The MythBusters investigate lightnings role in the discovery of electricity and find out whether proximity to common metals can make you more susceptible to being struck.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Pokemon Legends: Arceus And Super Smash Bros. Ultimate!
programme.desc: We go on a legendary Pokemon filled adventure in our review of Pokemon Legends: Arceus, and battle it out with iconic characters in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Ouch Awards is back! We reveal the four winners as the doctors surprise them at home.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer has taken up sculpting, but unintentionally drops a huge slab of stone on top of Timmys teddy!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand tries to sleep standing up, then finds out how virtual reality can help in surgery, before he and Dr Chris count down five things that make your skin crawl!

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven brings a mascot costume to life with Pearls magic shard in order to help his friend Peedee with his job, but the plan backfires when the mascot goes rogue.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears open a food truck after being disappointed by the food options available to them. In an effort to drum up business, they start selling their food to animals... until the animals go a little crazy.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Louis flies the entire family to Taiwan in an effort to make things right with his brother Gene. Jessica takes Eddie, Emery and Evan to her favourite childhood locales, including Dihua Street and Shilin Night Market.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edinas got an electronic organiser and a plan to become a model - of efficiency that is. And whats more efficient than flying to New York on Concorde for a doorknob?

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addies fundraising campaign disrupts a beloved village event and Maggies attempts to get help end in disaster.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Gokus Energy Is Out Of Control?! The Struggle To Look After Pan
programme.desc: Goku starts having trouble controlling his body and energy! After visiting with King Kai, he learns hes on strict bed rest until his energy levels out.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Security agents Owen and Ohio secretly provide backup on a case so they can have a pizza party.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Noah tries to rescue the chocolates Owen forgot outside.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: Robby invites Izzy to a drive-in movie, so all the Maltos tag along and go to extreme lengths to make it the best night ever - but theirÂ helpÂ transforms the movies science fiction into science reality...

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Girls Night Out crew decide to stay in and have a slumber party, but an unknown alien threat descends on Jump City.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Luca learn the importance of water when gardening and make a portable water lily pond.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a pong in the lab as the Doctors reveal the special part of your brain that helps you smell. Plus we meet snowboarding Brilliant Body Aimee Fuller.

programme.title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
programme.desc: How do you max out an egg drop? With pumpkins, of course! Material science is the focus of this episode: nitinol, ulexite, carbon nanotubes, hagfish slime, aerogel and a great deal of squashed pumpkins.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Its an undercover operation of the Welsh-valley variety for Agent Spencer as he finds himself in Llanharan, Pontyclun, with a house for sale thats in need of a re-vamp.

programme.title: ER
programme.sub-title: Do One, Teach One, Kill One
programme.desc: Things dont go as planned for Carter as he performs his first solo surgery. Susans feud with Kerry intensifies. Dr. Ross cares for a four-year-old Asian boy with AIDS. Shep hits on Carol, and Jeanie makes a decision.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy decide to move house and are viewing the home of their dreams when Lee asks to use the loo, causing unwanted tension with the vendor.

programme.title: Rage Ausmusic Month Special
programme.desc: rage celebrates AusMusic Month all November with the creme de la creme of new music videos from Australias best and brightest.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig gets railroaded into a Road and Rail-themed episode of QI alongside panellists Alan Davies, Aisling Bea, Cally Beaton and Holly Walsh.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Inner truths are revealed at Addies first ever sleepover. But when Jenna asks awkward questions about Miss Murphy, Keedie clams up. In the 16th century a jail break is planned.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: The Seal Of Planet Pot-au-feu - Secrets Of The Unleashed Superhuman Water!
programme.desc: After getting stuck in Monakas truck, Goten and Trunks wind up on Planet Pot-au-feu. Here, they protect an old man and get caught in a fight over...water? But the truth about this water could leave them high and dry.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When an unlucky coin is accidentally released into the public, the agents must retrieve it before the world ends.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Courtney must go all day without correcting her friends which is hard because they do everything wrong!

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: Robby, Mo, and the Terrans are invited to play Witwickys new Escape Room game. Twitch loves to win, so shes eager to help her team succeed - but the game is much more than meets the eye...

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: When Blackfire begins her plan to conquer Earth, the girls must pull out all the stops to defeat her.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners create the ultimate dinosaur backyard garden paradise, rawwwr!

programme.title: Show Me The Honey!
programme.sub-title: The Force Force, Lever Man and the Goldilocks Zone
programme.desc: Blue Peter presenter Mwaksy surprises one of the five, and they compete for a coveted Golden Honeybee in the beeswax candle-making challenge.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phils Secret Agent mission takes him to the affluent area of Pinner in Harrow and the five-bed family home of Vaseem, Ayeesha and their two children.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Benton is injured in a fight, so Carter is asked to replace him in surgery. Mark tries to end Weaver and Susans escalating feud. Shep risks his life to bring in a gunshot victim. Susans gastritis patient wont stop eating.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A couple turn an old fire engine into a bar, to raise money for charity. Max builds a shepherds Hut from scratch, including the nuts and bolts! George visits an extraordinary home in Chile and Will builds a telescope.

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Lies are uncovered as Mel and Asif are taken into police custody. Juliet tries to protect Taylor, and herself, from the investigation.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Ross argues with Greene about how best to care for dying AIDS patient, Chia-Chia. Benton treats an injured woman who refuses to press charges against her abusive policeman husband. The staff celebrates Weavers day off.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Upsy Daisy Dances With Pinky Ponk
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy shows her love for everything in the garden by dancing.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Squidgies garden looks so beautiful she decides to have a picnic for her friends but a big wind sweeps through Hoopla turning her garden into a mess and breaking her rake. How is she going to clean it in time for the picnic?

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is so excited for the Spring Sing at school today, but when he arrives, he discovers that Teacher Harriet is not there to teach the routine to the students. The class meets a substitute teacher named Mr. Malik.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to draw a big picture so Flop finds him some chalk to draw on the pavement. Bing draws a fabulous stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur but just as hes finished a rain shower washes the dinosaur away.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Suzy learn that grown-ups must work all day, and the children play at working in a shop at playgroup and find it very hard work.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmer gets stuck in the Loo, Bitzer must urgently deliver vital supplies. His initial efforts end in failure so he drafts in Shaun and the gang to help out.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Bastets inexperience of dealing with anyone other than Pharaoh Boy leads to Luna capturing her Sun Disc and becoming more powerful than ever.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Despite protests from the Wise Old Elf, Ben accompanies Holly to her first day at Magic School.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: During breakfast at the pirate cafe, the family meet Pirate Pete and Mrs Mermaid who invite everyone to their evening show.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Ferdinands beloved Snack Shack is damaged in a storm, Neville organises a fundraiser to buy him a new one.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When Dad runs out of marmalade Big Lizard shows Cosima a plant growing Proximan oranges. Its leaves turn out to be giant bugs who arent happy about sharing their fruit!

programme.title: Play School: Let The Music Play
programme.desc: Michelle and Nicholas dance along to the rhythm, rapping their way through the shape of music! Kiya and Little Ted go on a sound search in the big city and find lots of new sounds.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crews favourite car racing movie series, The Quick and the Curious, invites fans to make their own racing movie, with the best entry being shown on TV before the real movie airs.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Monster Camp
programme.desc: When Jay discovers Nikhil had camped in the wild, he wants to have a monster camping adventure in their garden. Will they meet any monsters? And will Jay be as brave as Nikhil?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Mole goes to find the Sound Collector, and soon finds herself playing hide and squeak.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Morgan thinks he only has bad luck and the Bananas try to persuade him that this isnt true.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come along on a fun-filled food adventure with The Wiggles! Dance along to classics like Hot Potato and Fruit Salad and sing along with a new favourite Marshmallow for a delicious episode of Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig and Daddy Pig discover how fun scooters are.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: During a snowball fight, Ginger and the Pea-Rexes accidentally wake up a Kiwimammuthus from its hibernation and have to tire out the furry beast to get it back to sleep.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Pippen loses her voice before her concert. Can Vida help her get it back in time for her solo?

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts help a group of algae-eating fish stand up to some aggressive damselfish, who are harming their own reef by over-farming it with algae.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Kevin doesnt think hell ever be top dog; hes not "wolfy" enough to find the legendary bone. With Gekkos help, they both learn its through caring for others one becomes "top dog".

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily worries she doesnt have a best friend, but, when the other engines help her out of a tricky situation, she realises shes been surrounded by best friends all along.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids explore a tropical fruit farm and learn about how they grow, how to pick them and then feast on fruits theyve never tried before.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles in the enchanting world of dolls! Dorothy needs assistance with her Dorothy doll, so they call on Dolly Dr. Sahara for help. Will she be able to save the day?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes the whole class to London for the day and gets a tour by The Queen herself!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Did Mojo and Bo paint road lines going in all the wrong directions? Yes they did!

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Greg feels scared on an overnight camping trip. He thinks his nighttime powers will help him but Orticia has something worrying in store.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington hurts his knee and goes to see Dr Yasmin. When she steps out, he steps UP and is mistaken for a doctor.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Carrot wants to become superstrong, so she restores Evil Peas robot suit for herself.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey wants to help Dad make Bingos birthday cake, but first she must put away her toys. But nothing can tempt her to clean up, until Dad drops the cake.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos trousers get mixed up all over the place in the Ninky Nonk, in the Pinky Ponk.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop is fixing Mimis teapot with very sticky glue, its so sticky that everyone in Hoopla gets stuck together. How are they going to get unstuck?

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Teddy and Leo lose their toy cars, and since Daniel doesnt use his anymore, he gives them to the twins to enjoy. When he sees how happy his gift makes them, Daniel decides to give Margaret his old rocking chair, too.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Ammas vegetable patch with a comical face, so they take it under their wing, naming it "Nosey".

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family spot a rainbow when they go for a drive.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is stressed out and has had enough of the farm and its inhabitants. He storms off for a break, suitcase in hand, only to reappear almost immediately, the same, but somehow different.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy needs to teach Bastet to drive, but his efforts just result in Carly and Cartoka stealing the speed of the Catcars. Catboy has to join forces with Bastet to go to Zoomzania and get it back.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: After the disappearance of Mrs Fotheringill, Mrs Elf becomes the twins new teacher.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The cruise visits an island which is full of souvenir stalls. Grandpa Pig finds a colourful shirt, Granny Pig buys a tropical gnome, George chooses a ukulele and Peppa chooses a dancing doll and cuddly whale for Goldie.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Pounces dad Hoppa visits Kangaroo Beach for the day, Pounce tries to cram everything into one day and forgets to heed basic safety principles.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: After a storm passes overhead many creatures turn up in surprising places and need Cosima and Big Lizards help. But try as they might our friends cant find poor Rex.

programme.title: Play School: Let The Music Play
programme.desc: Join Miah and Matt as they explore loud and soft sounds with lots of different instruments. Kim and Lisa go into town to see their friends perform for The Big City Buzz Fest!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew comes together to help Mels father Mikisew when he needs a new idea for his Art and Music Festival art piece. A giant marimba is created to make a fresh and exciting art/music installation.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Missing Appalams
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay are detectives today. When the homemade appalams go missing under their watch, they need to solve the case and save lunch!

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector gets lost in the fog, and has to use sound to get him home.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: After they accidentally damage the turtles waterhole, the Bananas have to try and repair it quick smart.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Spread joy and happiness with Caterina, Bubbles the Mermaid, and The Wiggles in this episode all about friendship!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes the whole class to London for the day and gets a tour by The Queen herself!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes help a young Cornasaurolophus reach the top of a hot volcano where the heat will make its kernels pop and allow a fresh new coat.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Tidbit swallows a watermelon seed and worries hes going to grow a watermelon in his tummy.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Porcupine Puffer
programme.desc: Barnacles, Kwazii and Peso venture back inside a whale shark to retrieve a porcupine puffer fish that was accidentally swallowed.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Desperate to prove himself, Gekko recruits Armadylan for extra training.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas discovers a missing dog on the railway and tries to find it a new home.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the kids are inspired by a mural in a community garden by a local French artist, Hugues Sineux. They paint pots and add plants to complement the artwork and make the green space even more beautiful.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles for a fun musical adventure all about emotions! Sing along to "If Youre Happy and You Know It." Lachy feels sad when Wags chews his socks, but luckily Dorothy has a great idea!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its school project time for Peppa and her friends which means they have to build castles and bring them into playgroup!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie finds a baby bird in need of a home, she decides to build a special birdhouse.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets become stranded on Boomerang Island, but Neville vows to save the day with his backpack of supplies and emergency underpants.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Orticia gets invited to Octobellas cave to help grow powerful pondweed.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington learns about bees and decides to help them make honey by planting a flower garden but someone thinks theyre weeds!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea is tricked by lots of Supertatoes who appear all over the supermarket.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At a party, Bingo is desperate to show off her handstand skills, while Nanna cant find a way to make herself useful. Theyre both feeling a bit lost, until they find each other.

programme.desc: Kevin returns to see Sue and Martin in Devon. In 1999, they began the renovation of a couple of 16th and 18th century barns. Two decades later, Kevin finds a home lovingly, painstakingly transformed. (Final)

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Growers call for people to buy local as the big supermarkets look overseas for produce, another big cleanup for southern Queensland as storms batter the region, plus forget Flemington - the Top End has the croc cup.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Federal Government shutdown now the longest in history. Zohran Mamdani elected Mayor of New York City and Democrats win key Governor elections in New Jersey and Virginia. Californians vote in support of new congressional map.

programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: Whitlam Dismissal: 50 Years
programme.desc: The dismissal of an elected Australian Government has only happened once. 50 years ago Sir John Kerr sensationally sacked PM Gough Whitlam. Greg Jennett looks at the legacy of the historic event and how it shaped democracy.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: The longest government shutdown in US history looks set to end, but not everyones happy. Chas and John discuss the fallout and last weeks election backlash against Trump. Plus former Speaker Nancy Pelosi retires.
